snippet: Documents released after 30 years suggest that British special forces had helped draw up plans for the attack at the Golden Temple at Amritsar, India.
abstract: British government says it will open investigation into June 1984 raid on Golden Temple at Amritsar, India, that killed 400 people following release of documents suggesting that British special forces helped plan attack; raid was carried out by Indian troops in effort to flush out separatists.
lead_paragraph: Documents released after 30 years suggest that British special forces had helped draw up plans for the attack at the Golden Temple at Amritsar, India.

headline.main: Documents Spur British Inquiry Over 1984 Raid at Indian Shrine
headline.print_headline: Documents Spur British Inquiry Over 1984 Raid At Indian Shrine
